item.title: Report E-2024040018
item.description:
Report E-2024040018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that regulated UN1203 "VP SEF 4-Cycle Fuel" was released from two (2) one-gallon metal pails impacting their box and Trailer #311-7506 due to the pail lids not being secured. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The generated waste was placed into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum containing the impacted Oil Dri absorbents, the damaged metal pails, and the PPE.

item.title: Report E-2024040054
item.description:
Report E-2024040054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was unloading drums from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Azusa, CA. The employee used a forklift with a drum grabber attachment to pick up the 55 poly drum by it's lip. Prior to moving the drum, the drum appeared to be in good condition as there was no visible deficiencies identified by the forklift operator. Once the employee began to back up the drum, the drum lip broke off causing the drum to fall and break. Approximately 20 gallons was released onto the trailer and cement floor (all in secondary containment). The spill was immediately cleaned up. After investigating the incident, Veolia believes that the plastic was brittle but unfortunately, we are not sure of the cause of the brittleness since the site only utilizes a few of these drums.

item.description:
Report E-2024040006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: SANTA FE SPGS
  • State: CA

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO terminal ULA contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Santa Fe Springs, CA. The spill consists of 1-19 liter metal can of ERS Racing Fuels, which were found spilled out onto the trailer floor, approximately 1 liters worth was on the ground and already dried at the time of arrival due to being crushed by other freight. The terminal stated there may be more cans that were damaged but they will not know until they break the pallet down.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4-ounces of VP Small Engine Fuel was released from one (1) 1-gallon metal can due to improper loading. The release impacted Trailer #3151479. No oil dri was used. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged can was containerized into one (1) 5-gallon metal can.

item.title: Report I-2024100030
item.description:
Report I-2024100030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-30T00:33:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Individual not a company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1900000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the filling of the trailer, an end plug thermal pressure relief device (TPRD) had an unplanned activation. The TPRD vent manifold intended to safely route any venting gas appeared to be improperly assembled allowing high pressure hydrogen gas to escape through leaks in the vent manifold. The resulting leaks created ignited the hydrogen causing significant damage to the trailer and damage to the another trailer being filled along side the trailer that caught fire.

item.title: Report X-2024031363
item.description:
Report X-2024031363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNLOAD MANAGER CAME TO QA AT ABOUT 5AM AND INFORMED QA THERE WAS A HAZMAT DAMAGE AT ONE OF THE UNLOAD BAY DOORS. QA IMMEDIATELY WENT OVER THERE AND INSPECTED THE AREA AND LUCKILY THERE WASNT ANY AFFECTED SURFACE AREAS IN THE TRAILER, HOWEVER, FIVE BOXES WERE SPILLED ON. THE UNLOAD MANAGER PUT THE DAMAGED HAZMAT INTO A HAZBAG AND QA PUT IT INTO A LINED BIN AND IT WAS BROUGHT OVER TO THE QA TABLE FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: AT FIRST GLANCE THERE WAS A WET SPOT ON THE SIDE OF THE BOX BUT NO OTHER SIGNS OF DAMAGE. WHEN QA OPENED THE PACKAGE THERE WAS A 2.5 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE OF CONCENTRATED LIQUID DISHMACHINE DETERGENT THAT HAD A LOOSE CAP AND HAD SPILLED ONTO THE SLOTTED PARTITION THAT WAS USED TO BRACE IT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED HAZMAT WAS QUICKLY PUT INTO A HAZBAG AND THEN PUT INTO A LINED BIN. THE SPILLED ON PACKAGES WERE REMOVED AND PUT ON THE SPILL TRAY AND COLLECTED AFTER THE HAZMAT WAS SAFELY MOVED TO THE QA TABLE.

item.title: Report X-2024031295
item.description:
Report X-2024031295

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Metal drum was at the rear terminus of moving NC belt, the weight of the oncoming packages forced a protruding metal rod from another package to impact the drum, puncturing it and forcing it over the side of the belt onto the floor below. Punctured drum was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote, spreading spill on floor was contained using absorbent tubing, spilled material was squeegied into containment zone and mopped up using absorbent pads. DescribePack: Metal drum was punctured on the side about an inch or beneath the top lid of the drum. The puncture runs about an inch in length, between an 8th and a 1/4 inch in width. In addition, wet label and denting on other side of drum suggestive of a very small crack, likely the result of the impact with the floor. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Area was evacuated, Punctured drum was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote, spreading spill on floor was contained using absorbant tubing, spilled material was squeegied into containment zone and mopped up using absorbant pads. Fans used to disperse fumes.

item.title: Report X-2024031258
item.description:
Report X-2024031258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20

The package was then placed in a red tote to be taken to the hazmat area for further inspection and process DescribePack: upon inspecting the content inside the package the area that the leak happened was at the top and side of the closure area which possibly the content had a bad closure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was carefully placed in a red tote

item.title: Report X-2024031187
item.description:
Report X-2024031187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2024031187, X-2024031188, X-2024031189: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. WHEN MOVING THE PACKAGE FOR PROPER TRANSPORTATION TO VAN LINE, THE LEAKAGE WAS NOTED. THE AREA WAS CLEARED, PPE ALONG WITH NEUTRALIZER WAS RETRIEVED. NEUTRALIZER WAS APPLIED TO THE SPILL. BAY DOORS WERE OPENED TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL AIR FLOW. DescribePack: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE ITEM/SPILL, IT WAS NOT CLEAR AS TO THE EXACT INNER PACKAGE FAILURE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: RED TOTES PRE-LINED WITH HAZMAT BAGS WERE USED TO PLACE IMPACTED BOXES INTO, WHICH STEMMED THE LEAKAGE AND REDUCED ADDITIONAL VAPOR DISPERSION. IN ADDITION, CHEMICAL NEUTRALIZER WAS APPLIED TO THE SPILL.

item.title: Report X-2024031122
item.description:
Report X-2024031122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024031122 SequenceEvent: QA was called to head towards load side 3 and upon arrival QA was notified that the package was leaking. Once QA was notified of damaged hazmat they then quarantined the area ran to get the apropriate gear and items to bag the package. Once they bagged all the packages they then nutralized the spilled content and cleaned the area. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom was wet and when we opened the package we inspected all bottles inside and noticed that there was a crack at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quarantined the area and placed spill mats and then spreaded out nutrilizing agent. 2. item.description:

  • City: OCEANSIDE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging was wet and ripped on one side and the bottom. The edges of the box shows a color staining indicative of corrosion. A plastic bag is inside but the contents are opposite of what the orientation arrow is pointing. DescribePack: Inside is a plastic ziploc bag holding 3 different ZEP product. The 1 qt spray bottle of Zep Acidic Toilet Bowl Cleaner had a loose sprayer cap, spilling around 4 fl oz of its content. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package immediately placed inside a plastic lined container and wiped off any spills.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The items/package were put in a salvage bin with a hazmat bag. For it could be taking to the hazmat cage.
